title: Hollyoaks newcomer Annie Wallace revealed as Hollyoaks High's next headteacher - Hollyoaks Soaps
text: Hollyoaks bosses have revealed that new cast member Annie Wallace will be playing the next headteacher of Hollyoaks High.The actress has been cast in the role of Sally St Claire, who'll be shaking things up at the school as a replacement for terminally-ill Patrick Blake (Jeremy Sheffield). © Lime PicturesPatrick and Mrs St Claire Sally makes her first appearance on screen next week, when she turns up at Hollyoaks High and announces that she'll be shadowing Patrick for the next two months.Patrick doesn't react well when Mrs St Claire tries to take over, but his furious outburst backfires when his new enemy immediately reports him to the board of governors. This leads to Patrick being made redundant and Mrs St Claire taking over with immediate effect.Wallace is the first ever transgender cast member to land a regular role on Hollyoaks. News of her casting was first revealed earlier this month, but her character details have been released for the first time today (October 20).Speaking of her new job, Wallace commented: "I'm delighted to be joining Hollyoaks as Mrs St Claire. She's such a great character and my first couple of scenes with Jeremy really show off her feisty personality - she's a force to be reckoned with. I hope the viewers love her as much as I do." © Lime PicturesSally St Claire Mrs St Claire is not a bully like Patrick, but she has a no-nonsense attitude which stems from a desire to help young people achieve the future they deserve.Married to the job and driven by career success, Mrs St Claire says that she has accepted the position at Hollyoaks High to "seek out the bad apples and make them into crumble".A Hollyoaks statement teased: "Make no mistake, there's nothing going on in class that Mrs St Claire doesn't know about. But she's also come to the village with an ulterior motive..."Journalist, presenter and transgender rights activist Paris Lees revealed Wallace's casting in a column for The Guardian two weeks ago, hours after BBC soap EastEnders announced that it had hired transgender actor Riley Carter Millington as new regular Kyle. Wallace had already been filming with Hollyoaks for a while. © Lime PicturesPatrick has been deteriorating due to his MND Lees wrote: "Hollyoaks is set to introduce [a] continuing transgender character later this month - a teacher, played by Annie Wallace. Wallace, too, is trans, although Hollyoaks - which quietly had Rebecca Root on the show in a non-trans role earlier this year - isn't making a song and dance about it."Wallace has been acting on British television for the past five years in what we call 'stealth' - keeping your mouth shut about your transition. She felt she had to. In 2015 she's changed her mind."Hollyoaks airs Wallace's first scenes on Thursday, October 29 at 6.30pm on Channel 4.Annie Wallace is joining the cast of Hollyoaks as a trans teacherRead more Hollyoaks spoilers and newsDigital Spy Soap Scoop video - hit play below for gossip on EastEnders' Halloween special, Nikhil's Emmerdale return, the Nightingale family's arrival in Hollyoaks and a new romance story for Mary in Coronation Street. function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID); modVP = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.VIDEO_PLAYER); modExp = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.EXPERIENCE); modCon = bcExp.getModule(APIModules.CONTENT); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.BEGIN, onVideoStart); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.STOP, onVideoStop); modVP.addEventListener(BCMediaEvent.PROGRESS, onVideoProgress); } #_containermyExperience4565610458001 { height: 100%; } // InSkin integration parameters: InSkinParams['myInSkin14565610458001'] = { 'srv_SectionID': '', 'srv_SectionIDPlay': '123757', 'srv_Keywords': '', 'plr_ContentID': 'myExperience4565610458001', 'plr_ContentType': 'BRIGHTCOVE3', 'plr_ContentW': 558, 'plr_ContentH': 314, 'plr_NoSkinContentResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinContentW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinContentH': 348, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinResize': true, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinW': 618, 'plr_NoSkinInSkinH': 348, 'plr_ResizeOnHideSkin': true, 'plr_HideSkinOnExternalAd': 'all', 'plr_ShowSkinAfterExternalAd': true, 'cnt_SmartPlayer': true }; // create the InSkin object: var InSkinObject4565610458001 = new InSkin.Base('myInSkin14565610458001'); brightcove.createExperiences(); if (!navigator.userAgent.match(/Android/i)) { InSkinObject4565610458001.init(); ai_type="video"; } Get the Inside Soap magazine on your iPhone or iPad
